means: 赎回的，挽回的，用于补偿的

sentence.Network_en: We understand how great he is because of his redemptive work.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们了解他救赎之功的伟大。

sentence.Network_en: Continue to work with the faith that unearned suffering is redemptive.
sentence.Network_cn: 不该受的苦难可以为自己赎罪,怀着这个信念,继续努力吧!

entry.tran: （基督教中）挽救的，救赎的，拯救的
entry.def: In Christianity, a redemptive act or quality is something which leads to freedom from the consequences of sin and evil.

means.word_mean: 1. of or relating to or resulting in redemption;
2. bringing about salvation or redemption from sin;

auth_sentence.content: The only redemptive touch was the marmalade.
auth_sentence.res_content: The only redemptive touch was the marmalade.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The only redemptive touch was the marmalade.

auth_sentence.content: Yet there were many moments of redemptive glory in his great struggle.
auth_sentence.res_content: Yet there were many moments of redemptive glory in his great struggle.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Yet there were many moments of redemptive glory in his great struggle.

auth_sentence.content: He rang and we had a conversation and it was a very redemptive, beautiful thing.
auth_sentence.res_content: He rang and we had a conversation and it was a very redemptive, beautiful thing.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He rang and we had a conversation and it was a very redemptive, beautiful thing.
